p: More variable effect was noted in evaluation of root elongation after application of EO in different doses ( Table 3). Except expected inhibition effect, also stimulation effect was noted. Significant stimulation effects were observed in dicotyledonous model plants. Roots of L. sativum at the lowest EO dose (0.062 μg/mL) were 10% longer in comparison to control. In monocotyledonous model plant T. aestivum the influence was the most significant at the highest dose (2.5 μg/mL) when the roots were 67% longer than in control.
